Material used.Description: Experiments used HEK293 cells overexpressing wild-type or E26K alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: E26K variant showed significantly higher ThT fluorescence (indicating increased amyloid fibril formation) compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for ThT assays.

Technical replicates.Description: Each ThT measurement was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected HEK293 cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ThT fluorescence intensity < 20% of E26K variant

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ThT fluorescence intensity ≥ 20% of E26K variant

Material used.Description: TEM was performed on mouse primary neurons expressing E26K or wild-type alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: E26K-expressing neurons exhibited dense amyloid fibrils with increased number and length compared to wild-type neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in three independent neuronal cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was imaged in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein-expressing neurons were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transfected neurons were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantitative analysis of fibril density using ImageJ software.
